item.title: 摩根大通放弃就马斯克推特和认股权证起诉特斯拉
item.description: 摩根大通同意撤销三年前对特斯拉公司提起的诉讼，该诉讼要求赔偿与股票权证交易相关的 1.62 亿美元。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. agreed to drop a lawsuit it filed against Tesla Inc. three years ago seeking $162 million tied to stock warrant transactions.】

item.title: 急于 "升值 "可能是亚洲股市抵御特朗普的最佳策略
item.description: 在日本的启发下，一种寻求提高股东回报、公司治理和市场估值的战略正像野火一样在亚洲蔓延。【原文：A Japan-inspired strategy of seeking to boost shareholder returns, corporate governance and market valuations is spreading like a wildfire across Asia.】

item.title: 穆迪将巴拿马债务展望降至负面，巴拿马债务濒临 "垃圾 "边缘
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将巴拿马的信用展望从稳定下调至负面，使其更接近于第二个垃圾级，因为这个中美洲国家面临着财政账户恶化的问题。【原文：Panama’s credit outlook was lowered to negative from stable by Moody’s Ratings, putting it closer to a second junk grade, as the Central American country faces deterioration in its fiscal accounts.】

item.title: 穆迪评级将匈牙利信用展望降至负面
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将匈牙利的债务前景从稳定下调至负面，理由是匈牙利的治理能力较弱，有可能失去欧盟的拨款和低成本贷款。【原文：Moody’s Ratings lowered the outlook of Hungary’s debt to negative from stable, citing weaker governance that risks losing grants and low-cost loans from the European Union.】

item.title: S&P坚持法国评级，为总理巴尼耶缓刑
item.description: 由于 S&P 全球评级公司重申了对法国债务的评估，法国总理米歇尔-巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）在通过预算和继续执政的斗争中赢得了一点缓和。【原文：French Prime Minister Michel Barnier won a minor reprieve in his battle to pass a budget and remain in power as S&P Global Ratings reiterated its assessment of the country’s debt.】

item.title: 社交媒体对孩子有害。如何应对？
item.description: 尽管有越来越多的证据表明社交媒体对青少年不利，但他们还是经常长时间使用社交媒体。健康专家列出的危害包括失眠、饮食失调和自杀。【原文：Young people often spend long hours on social media despite mounting evidence that it’s not good for them. Health experts list harms as varied as lost sleep, eating disorders and suicide.】

item.title: 关键利率上调，卢拉任命三位央行行长
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周五提名了三位新的央行董事会成员，因为投资者要求央行更积极地提高利率，以冷却经济和抑制通货膨胀。【原文：Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva nominated three new central bank board members on Friday as investors pressure for more aggressive interest rate hikes to cool the economy and tame inflation.】

item.title: 斯托利品牌伏特加美国分公司申请破产保护
item.description: Stoli 品牌伏特加和肯塔基猫头鹰波旁酒的所有者 Stoli 集团的美国分公司已申请破产。【原文：The US arm of Stoli Group, the owner of Stoli brand vodka and Kentucky Owl bourbon, has filed bankruptcy.】

item.title: 墨西哥启动制止非法中国物品流动行动
item.description: 据墨西哥经济部称，墨西哥正计划在全国范围内开展 "清理 "行动，以打击主要从中国入境的非法商品流通。【原文：Mexico is planning to carry out a “cleaning” operation across the country to combat the flow of illegal merchandise entering the country mainly from China, according to the Economy Ministry.】

item.title: 通胀降温，尼日利亚卡多佐发出明年降息信号
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行行长奥拉耶米-卡多佐（Olayemi Cardoso）明确表示，如果通胀压力如期降温，高利率将在未来几个月内得到缓解。【原文：Central Bank of Nigeria Governor Olayemi Cardoso gave a clear signal that high interest rates would be eased in coming months if inflation pressures cool as expected.】

item.title: 南方水务贷款人聘请顾问帮助稳定公用事业
item.description: 据知情人士透露，南方水务有限公司（Southern Water Ltd.）的一组贷款人已经请来顾问，帮助他们评估稳定这家英国公用事业公司局势的方案。【原文：A group of lenders to Southern Water Ltd. has brought advisers on board to help them assess options to stabilize the situation at the UK utility, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国资产超过世界其他地区，华尔街再次获胜
item.description: 在美国通胀数据加速、唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要对美国的一些近邻征收激进的关税、华尔街一半的人都在休假的这一周，S&P 500 指数仍然轻松击败了欧洲和亚洲的基准股指。【原文：In a week in which US inflation data accelerated, Donald Trump threatened some of America’s closest neighbors with aggressive tariffs, and half of Wall Street was on vacation, the S&P 500 still comfortably beat benchmark stock gauges for both Europe and Asia.】

item.title: 据说 Stifel 的瑞士股票团队将加入 Oddo BHF
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Stifel Financial Corp.专注于瑞士股票的团队成员已经离开该公司，即将加入 Oddo BHF SCA。【原文：Members of Stifel Financial Corp.’s team focused on Swiss equities have left the firm and are set to join Oddo BHF SCA, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 阿根廷寻求几十年来首次向中国出口小麦
item.description: 据阿根廷最大的小麦出口集团负责人称，阿根廷小麦贸易商正在寻求完成自 20 世纪 90 年代以来首次对华大量销售。【原文：Argentina wheat traders are seeking to close their first significant sales to China since the 1990s, according to the head of the country’s top crop-exporting group.】

item.title: ETF IQ：努里埃尔-鲁比尼（仍然）不喜欢加密货币
item.description: 欢迎收看 ETF IQ，这是一份专门报道 14 万亿美元全球 ETF 行业的周报。我是彭博新闻社记者兼主播凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to ETF IQ, a weekly newsletter dedicated to the $14 trillion global ETF industry. I'm Bloomberg News reporter and anchor Katie Greifeld.】

item.title: 加拿大最高法院裁定：不列颠哥伦比亚省可发起阿片类药物集体诉讼
item.description: 加拿大最高法院周五裁定，不列颠哥伦比亚省可以代表加拿大多国政府就阿片类药物的危害对制药公司提起集体诉讼。【原文：The province of British Columbia can bring a class action lawsuit against pharmaceutical companies for opioid harms on behalf of multiple governments across Canada, the country’s Supreme Court ruled on Friday.】

item.title: 日本央行上田告诉《日经新闻》工资趋势将推动政策调整
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，随着通胀和经济趋势的发展符合央行的预测，加息 "近在眼前"，但并未明确支持在 12 月份加息。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said interest-rate hikes are “nearing” as inflation and economic trends develop in line with the central bank’s forecasts, without explicitly supporting an increase in December.】

item.title: 巴西央行讨论外汇市场是否失灵
item.description: 巴西的政策制定者们争论的是，最近雷亚尔的暴跌是否发生在一个不再正常运行的市场中，这可能会成为货币当局进行干预的理由。【原文：Brazil’s policymakers debated whether the recent slump in the real occurred in a market that had ceased to operate normally, which might justify intervention by the monetary authority.】

item.title: 法国债券风险指数下降，交易商加大对巨额减持的赌注
item.description: 随着货币市场对欧洲央行加快降息的预期升温，法国债券以反弹结束了本周的动荡行情，一扫与德国债券相比表现不佳的颓势。【原文：French bonds capped a volatile week with a rally, erasing their underperformance versus German peers, as money markets priced in faster interest rate cuts from the European Central Bank.】

item.title: 加拿大称 "雪花黑客 "对公众构成威胁
item.description: 被指控对数十名雪花公司（Snowflake Inc.【原文：The man accused of carrying out cyberattacks against dozens of Snowflake Inc. customers will face an extradition hearing later this year, after Canadian officials accused him of cybercrimes and being “a risk of danger to the public, police and himself.”】

item.title: 加拿大顶级新闻出版商起诉 OpenAI 侵犯版权
item.description: 五家加拿大新闻媒体出版商起诉 OpenAI 公司侵犯版权，因为该公司为训练 ChatGPT — 等人工智能产品而剪辑内容；这是针对这家市值 1570 亿美元的初创公司的又一诉讼。【原文：Five Canadian news media publishers have sued OpenAI Inc. for breaching copyright by scraping content to train artificial intelligence products like ChatGPT — opening another front against the $157 billion startup.】

item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. has brought forward its call for a half-point interest-rate cut from the European Central Bank to December, citing the bloc’s slowing economic activity.】

item.title: 德国汽车零部件制造商马勒据称将酝酿印度子公司的首次公开募股
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，德国汽车零部件制造商马勒公司（Mahle GmbH）正在考虑对其印度业务进行首次公开募股。【原文：German car-parts maker Mahle GmbH is considering an initial public offering of its Indian business, people familiar with the matter said, joining other foreign firms in seeking to list their units in the nation’s buoyant markets.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州石油城敖德萨跻身美国工资最高城市之列
item.description: 得克萨斯州石油城敖德萨和丹佛市在过去一年中跻身美国周薪最高的十大都市区之列。【原文：Texas oil town Odessa and Denver joined the top 10 US metropolitan areas with the highest weekly wages over the past year.】

item.title: 特朗普的加密货币项目一败涂地，直到贾斯汀-孙介入
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的加密货币项目 "世界自由金融公司"（World Liberty Financial）看来要泡汤了。当选总统和他的儿子们几周来一直在宣传其加密货币，称它将 "让金融再次伟大"，但该行业在很大程度上拒绝了它。销售额比目标少了 93%，以至于未能达到向特朗普支付报酬的最低要求。【原文：Donald Trump’s crypto project, World Liberty Financial, was looking like a bust. The president-elect and his sons had been promoting its cryptocurrency for weeks, saying it would “make finance great again,” but the industry largely rejected it. Sales fell 93% short of the goal, so low they failed to hit the minimum required to trigger a payout to Trump.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商雄狮电动车因现金减少而临近债权人最后期限
item.description: 本周末是加拿大电动卡车和公共汽车制造商雄狮电动汽车公司（Lion Electric Co.）寻找新投资者的最后期限，该公司正面临资金紧张和电动汽车市场动荡的困境。【原文：Canada’s electric truck and bus manufacturer Lion Electric Co. is up against a deadline this weekend to find new investors amid a cash crunch and an EV market that’s in turmoil.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统称有信心避免美国加征关税
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆在墨西哥城对记者说，她相信墨西哥能够与美国达成协议，避免美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收 25% 的关税。【原文：Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum is convinced that her country can reach a deal with the US to avoid the 25% tariff threatened by US President-elect Donald Trump, she told reporters in Mexico City.】

item.title: 俄罗斯银行称无需采取紧急措施稳定卢布汇率
item.description: 俄罗斯央行表示，无需采取紧急措施支撑卢布，因为已有的措施足以稳定市场形势。【原文：Russia’s central bank said no emergency steps were required to prop up the ruble as measures already in place were enough to stabilize the market situation.】
